author: Georgina Torbet
title: Why NASA is sticking with Boeing
description: Despite the Starliner debacle, NASA is standing by Boeing and expressed confidence in the aerospace company. The reasons are complex and have a lot to do with SpaceX and Elon Musk.
content:
Photo by Paul Hennessy / Anadolu via Getty Images

 


 The Starliner debacle fueled speculation that the space agency would dump Boeing. But if it did, it would be left with SpaceX — and Elon Musk.… [+17136 chars]

author: Adam Kovac
title: So-Called 'Space Balloon' Completes Crucial Test Ahead of Tourist Flights
description: Space Perspective is hoping to have commercial operations underway in 2025, but a seat on the luxurious balloon is gonna cost you.
content: The dream, if you can call it that, of ballooning to not-quite-space, has gotten closer. Space Perspective, a company founded with the goal of floating people high in the Earths atmosphere in lavish … [+3485 chars]

author: Passant Rabie
title: Dramatic Video Shows the Closest Flyby Ever of Mercury
description: BepiColombo captured stunning views of the innermost planet on its way to explore its magnetic field.
content:
A pair of Mercury probes got up close and personal with the solar system's underdog planet, revealing its cratered surface in a newly released video of the otherworldly encounter.
